description.value:
Totem of Rat

Totem Spirit (Cunning) — Creation Cost: 6 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Survival / Adaptation / Cunning

Recommended Umbra Spirits (CR 8+)

To bind Rat, the pack must confront a spirit that embodies endurance through cleverness, scavenging, and refusal to die quietly. Suitable spirits include:

  • Elder Plague-Scavenger Spirit (Rat Aspect) — Suggested base: Swarm-infused monstrosity or spirit beast (CR 8–9), reflavored as a single intelligent Umbra entity
  • Urban Shadow Spirit — Suggested base: Oinoloth- or Yugoloth-style stat block (CR 8–10), stripped of fiendish alignment and treated as a survival-focused spirit
  • Gnawing Under-City Spirit — Suggested base: Spirit-empowered Giant Rat conglomerate (CR 8), functioning as one creature rather than a swarm

These spirits rarely fight honorably. They test the pack's ability to adapt, escape, bargain, or outlast superior force.

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • You gain advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks
  • When you fail a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw, you may reroll the save and take the new result (once per long rest)

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Rat's cunning.

For 1 minute, while within 30 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members may take the Hide action as a bonus action
  • Once during the duration, when a pack member would be reduced to 0 hit points, they may instead drop to 1 hit point and immediately move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks

This movement must end in cover or concealment if possible.

Ban — Survive to Fight Again

Rat demands adaptability, not pride.

The pack must not willingly choose a hopeless fight when retreat, deception, or avoidance is reasonably possible.

If the pack repeatedly sacrifices survival for pride or refuses to withdraw from unwinnable situations, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Rat may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
